name: SpeakersJS
tagline: A place for speakers, prospective speakers, mentors, and members of the community to ideate and collaborate on Javascript talks
body:
## Mission

### To help more people deliver better talks about Javascript by connecting speakers and prospective speakers with mentors and members of the community to ideate and collaborate.

## Communities

### [NationJS 2015](https://github.com/speakersjs/nationjs-2015)

## Contributing

### Organizers

To add your community, please open a [pull request](https://github.com/speakersjs/speakersjs.github.io/pulls).

### Speakers and Prospective Speakers

To connect with your community, open an issue in your community's repository. Make your issue title clear and your issue description full of all the information you can think of to help your community help you.

Examples:

- If you're looking for help choosing a topic, you could open an issue with a few topic ideas you're considering.
- If you're looking for help responding to a call for proposals, you could post a draft of your response and ask for feedback.
- If you're looking for help finishing a talk, you could open an issue with a link to an outline or Google doc with what you've got so far.
- If you're looking for feedback on a finished talk before you deliver it, you could open an issue with a link to a webcast recording of your presentation.

### Mentors and Community Members
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
